criteria: Identification of Family Rules Regarding Substance Use
Identification of School Rules Regarding Substance Use
descriptions: The student does not identify any family rules regarding alcohol, tobacco, or drug use.
The student identifies one family rule, but it is vague or unclear.
The student identifies one specific family rule regarding substance use.
The student identifies two specific family rules regarding substance use.
The student identifies three or more specific family rules regarding substance use.
The student identifies multiple specific family rules and explains the rationale behind them.
The student does not identify any school rules regarding alcohol, tobacco, or drug use.
The student identifies one school rule, but it is vague or unclear.
The student identifies one specific school rule regarding substance use.
The student identifies two specific school rules regarding substance use.
The student identifies three or more specific school rules regarding substance use.
The student identifies multiple specific school rules and explains the consequences of breaking them.
The student provides inaccurate or incomplete information about family and school rules.
The student provides mostly inaccurate or incomplete information about family and school rules.
The student provides some accurate and complete information, but with significant gaps.
The student provides mostly accurate and complete information with minor gaps.
The student provides accurate and complete information about both family and school rules.
The student provides accurate and complete information and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the rules.
